skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: ArtemisAI

security_audit.summary: This skill provides guidance and Python utility scripts for creating new skills. All 108 static findings are false positives: the scanner incorrectly flagged regex module usage as 'weak crypto', markdown code fences as 'shell execution', and benign text strings as 'C2 keywords'. The actual code only performs local file operations for skill initialization, validation, and packaging with no network access, credential handling, or dangerous patterns.

content.value_statement: Creating effective skills from scratch takes knowledge of the skill format. This guide provides a step-by-step process with utility scripts for initializing, validating, and packaging skills that extend Claude with specialized knowledge and workflows.
actual_capabilities: Initialize new skill directories with proper structure
Validate skill format and frontmatter requirements
Package skills into distributable zip files
Guide on organizing scripts, references, and assets
Provide reusable workflow and task templates
limitations: Does not execute user code or access external APIs
Only creates local files within specified output directory
Requires manual editing to complete skill content

use_cases.title: Build company-wide skills
use_cases.description: Create standardized skills that encode company knowledge, coding standards, and workflows for consistent AI assistance.

use_cases.title: Package domain expertise
use_cases.description: Transform domain knowledge, schemas, and business logic into reusable skills that can be shared with others.

use_cases.title: Bundle tool integrations
use_cases.description: Create skills that include scripts and assets for specific file formats, APIs, or automation tasks.

prompt_templates.title: New skill from scratch
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new skill for a specific task
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill called [skill-name] for [task-description]. Walk me through the Skill Creation Process step by step.

prompt_templates.title: Validate existing skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my skill at [path/to/skill] using the quick validation script. Report any issues found.

prompt_templates.title: Package skill for sharing
prompt_templates.prompt: Package my skill at [path/to/skill] into a zip file. Where should the output go?

prompt_templates.title: Design skill structure
prompt_templates.scenario: Planning what to include in a skill
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create a skill for [use-case]. Help me identify what scripts, references, and assets would be useful to include.

output_examples.input: Help me create a new skill called pdf-helper for working with PDF documents
output: To create a pdf-helper skill, follow these steps:
1. Run init_skill.py to create the skill structure
2. Add scripts like merge_pdfs.py, rotate_pages.py, extract_text.py
3. Create references for PDF specifications and API docs
4. Include assets like templates for output files

output_examples.input: How should I structure a skill for building React web applications?
output: Scripts: Project initialization, build automation, testing setup
References: React documentation, component patterns, best practices
Assets: Hello-world template with HTML/React boilerplate files

best_practices: Include scripts only when the same code would otherwise be rewritten repeatedly
Use references files for detailed documentation to keep SKILL.md lean
Organize assets separately from documentation since they are used in output, not context
anti_patterns: Duplicating information in both SKILL.md and references files
Including large documentation files directly in SKILL.md
Creating skills without concrete examples of how they will be used

faq.question: What tools are compatible with this skill?
faq.answer: The skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Utility scripts run in any Python 3 environment.

faq.question: What are the naming requirements for a skill?
faq.answer: Skill names must use hyphen-case (lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens only), maximum 40 characters.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with existing skill repositories?
faq.answer: Yes. The initialization script creates new skills while the validation and packaging scripts work with existing skill folders.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using the utility scripts?
faq.answer: Yes. Scripts only create files in specified directories and do not access system files, credentials, or networks.

faq.question: Why is my skill validation failing?
faq.answer: Common issues include missing SKILL.md, malformed YAML frontmatter, missing required name or description fields, or invalid characters in the skill name.

faq.question: How is this different from MCP servers?
faq.answer: Skills provide procedural knowledge and guidance while MCP servers provide tool capabilities. Skills can include scripts but focus on how to accomplish tasks.
